AggOO::SharedPtr

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class AggOO::SharedPtr< T >

The SharedPtr is a reference-counted pointer, used where implicit destruction is required.
Remarks:
This is a basic shared pointer that uses a reference count to know when to delete a pointer.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class T>
AggOO::SharedPtr< T >::SharedPtr (  )  [inline]

Constructor, creates a null pointer.

Remarks:
Important! bind() must be called before using SharedPtr.

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
void AggOO::SharedPtr< T >::bind ( T *  data  )  [inline]

Bind data to the pointer.

Remarks:
Assumes the pointer is not initialized.

void AggOO::SharedPtr< T >::release (  )  [inline, protected]

Release the pointer

template<class T>
virtual void AggOO::SharedPtr< T >::destroy (  )  [inline, protected, virtual]

Destroy the pointer

Remarks:
If this causes a crash, there were pointers that were not freed prior to shutting down.
